abstract: Verizon Wireless announced it would buy Alltell to create the largest cellphone operator in the United States, while in Europe, a bid was made to create the world’s fourth-largest mobile operator.
snippet: Verizon Wireless announced it would buy Alltell to create the largest cellphone operator in the United States, while in Europe, a bid was made to create the world’s fourth-largest mobile operator.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN  A multibillion-dollar telecommunications merger was announced Thursday, reflecting a trend for mobile phone operators to consolidate in their own crowded backyards while they scout for growth in emerging economies.

headline.main: Mergers Accelerate as Telecoms Seek Growth
headline.print_headline: Mergers Accelerate As Telecoms Seek Growth

abstract: The deal catapults Verizon’s wireless business ahead of AT&T Wireless, which falls to No. 2, followed by Sprint Nextel and Deutsche Telecom’s T-Mobile.
snippet: The deal catapults Verizon’s wireless business ahead of AT&T Wireless, which falls to No. 2, followed by Sprint Nextel and Deutsche Telecom’s T-Mobile.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications agreed on Thursday to buy Alltel for about $28.1 billion, including the assumption of debt, creating the nation’s largest cellular telephone provider.

headline.main: Verizon Agrees to Buy Alltel for $28.1 Billion
headline.print_headline: Verizon Agrees to Buy Alltel for $28.1 Billion

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Laura M. Holson
